climbs.name: Talon's Grip (aka Nestor)
climbs.fa: David Sampson, Arjun Heimsath, Nestor Garcia

content.description: Easier start than "Peregrin's" with a small roof to clear from the ledge. Ascend the shallow dihedral to crux move that gets you to awkward upper ledge and final short face to 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: To the right of Peregrin's the signature route of this sub area.

content.description: Tricky start to a ledge and a very committing low roof -- note where the bolt is BEFORE you start the climb. Pull the roof and ascend the delicate arete before the crux upper roof that will likely be a difficult on sight.
content.location: First climb in the Talon's Grip sub-area, this starts slightly inset into a recess. The tricky start is part of the climb, but you can "cheat" to get through it if you need to.

climbs.name: The Perch
climbs.fa: Arjun Heimsath, David Sampson, Bridget Hatfield

content.description: Committing start to clear low, bolt-protected roof on right (climbing left, on arête through roof, is 5.11 opening moves). Stay right of arête past bolts and ledges to large ledge right of Talon's Grip anchors. Don't get lured right by the anchors. Continue to the top of feature using small to medium protection to 2 bolt anchors climbers left of small tree. Single line rap, but not really that effective for TRing.
content.protection: Small to medium cams, though you could also use a #2 and #3 up high if you had them. 5 bolts.
content.location: Marked on the overview map, this is the long line to the right of the two sport routes in this sub-area.

climbs.name: Drawing Blood
climbs.fa: David Sampson, Arjun Heimsath, Hanna Breetz

content.description: Chunky arete, but the rock is decent, with ledges and plenty of rest to 2 bolt anchor. Crux is at the top. Note that this feature was originally climbed ground up by AMH by ascending the broken crack system to the left. Poor rock quality and lame climbing led DAS to develop the arete and put in this far superior line.
content.location: On the next buttress to the right of Talon's Grip buttress. Bolt line marks the route.

content.description: Wide crack to 2 bolt anchor used for Drawing Blood.
content.protection: Single rack with some wide gear.
content.location: Around the corner of the buttress from Drawing Blood and slightly uphill. Last climb of this sub area and on the south face.

content.description: The middle, west facing region of Raptor Ridge, this area is marked by the two hard sport climbs: Peregrin's Prey (11+) and Talon's Grip (12-). Two more moderate lines (5.8 sport and 5.9 mixed) are good warm ups and a wide crack rounds out the selection for this sub-area.
